intro: Prangos colladonioides, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant thrives in hot, dry climates and is well adapted to sandy or rocky soils. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Prangos colladonioides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in challenging environments.
